metadata.Title: CVE-2023-42754 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel ipv4 stack.The socket buffer (skb) was assumed to be associated with a device beforecalling __ip_options_compile, which is not always the case if the skb isre-routed by ipvs. This issue may allow a local user with CAP_NET_ADMINprivileges to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic-64k - 5.15.0-91.101
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1
linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-91.101').
